body_html:
I am basically trying to complete feature parity against the heads used by non-ts estimators, e.g. https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/estimator/canned/head.py#L786 Right now it's using the shared _weights() function in canned/head.py to extract the weight column from the list of columns from input.

body:
I am basically trying to complete feature parity against the heads used by
non-ts estimators, e.g.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/estimator/canned/head.py#L786

Right now it's using the shared _weights() function in canned/head.py to
extract the weight column from the list of columns from input.

On Mon, Oct 2, 2017 at 2:14 PM Allen Lavoie <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Ah, so the idea is that each feature of the series can have its own
> weight? I suppose that could be useful. Could you add a unit test or two?
>
> —
